articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Tom Perry, Emily Rose
articles.description: A fresh wave of air raids hit Beirut's southern suburbs in the early hours of Saturday as Israel stepped up attacks on Hezbollah, after a massive strike on the Iran-backed movement's command centre that apparently targeted leader Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes rock Beirut, Hezbollah command centre hit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Recognized as a skilled orator, his speeches were followed by friend and foe alike.
articles.title: Nasrallah led Hezbollah to become regional force

articles.author: Rich McKay, Joseph Ax, Andrew Hay
articles.description: Authorities across a wide swath of the southeastern United States faced the daunting task on Saturday of cleaning up from Hurricane Helene, one of the most powerful to hit the country, as the death toll continued to rise.
articles.title: US southeast faces daunting task cleaning up from Helene; death toll rises

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two consecutive Russian attacks on a medical centre in Sumy in northeastern Ukraine on Saturday morning killed six people, Ukraine's interior minister said.
articles.title: Russian attacks on medical centre kill 6 people in Ukraine's Sumy, minister says

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Incessant rains in Nepal have unleashed floods and landslides that killed at least 10 people with seven missing during the last 24 hours, while disrupting transport, officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Nepal rains bring floods, landslides that kill 10, with seven missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Asia's strongest storm this year, Typhoon Yagi, caused damages estimated at 81.5 trillion dong ($3.31 billion) across northern Vietnam, or twice as much as previous estimates, state media said on Saturday.
articles.title: Vietnam estimates damages of $3.31 bln from Typhoon Yagi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's incoming prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba, will likely keep Yoshimasa Hayashi as chief cabinet secretary when he forms his cabinet, the Asahi newspaper reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Japan's Ishiba likely to keep Hayashi as chief cabinet secretary in cabinet, Asahi reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine shot down 69 of 73 drones during an overnight Russian attack that included two ballistic and two cruise missiles, the Ukrainian air force said on Saturday.
articles.title: Ukraine says it downed 69 drones, 2 missiles in overnight Russian attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Seventeen people were killed in mass shootings at two homes in a village in South Africa's Eastern Cape province and police said on Saturday they had launched a manhunt for the suspects.
articles.title: Seventeen killed in mass shootings at two homes in South African village

articles.author: Mushtaq Ali
articles.description: At least six people were killed when a charter helicopter crashed in northern Pakistan on Saturday, security sources said.
articles.title: Six people killed in Pakistan helicopter crash, security sources say
